newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's Napocor fails to sell unused uranium.
newsitem.headline: Manila's Napocor fails to sell unused uranium.

text.p: State-owned National Power Corp (Napocor) said on Wednesday it had failed to sell unused uranium worth $32 million.
Richard Lazatin, head of Napocor's bidding committee, said two bidders showed up, Siemens Power Corp and Nukem GmBh, but the bids were lower than the indicative price of $32 million.
Nukem offered $16 million for the uranium while Siemens Power, a unit of Siemens AG, submitted a $25.16 million bid.
The uranium was supposed to be used by Napocor for the 620-megawatt nuclear power plant that was built in the 1980s but has never operated because of structural defects.
Prior to the bidding, eight firms had expressed interests to buy the fuel, Lazatin said.
He said Napocor had a month to decide whether to relaunch the bidding process or negotiate with the highest bidder.
